1.content:
School had just finished as Arcadia rode the bus home, her headphones at max volume to silence the noise of the kids around her. As the bus stopped, she stood up and walked off the bus and across the road to her house.

"I'm home!" she called as she shut the door behind her.

"Hello!" her mother called from the kitchen doorway. Arcadia smiled and hugged her mother before heading into her room. Her room was designed in an oriental gothic theme, a 72" HD TV on the wall, a Xbox 360 and stereo system. She had a futon on the right wall and a twin sized bed decorated in black and silver butterflies. Arcadia sighed deeply and dropped her backpack next to the closet door as she plopped down onto her bed. She swung her legs freely over the bed's edge and closed her eyes before her mother's voice rang out through the silence

"Arcadia! Don't forget your little friend is coming to stay for the weekend! CLEAN UP!" She shouted from the kitchen. Arcadia mumbled and nodded to herself before hopping up from her bed.

~ A few hours later~

Arcadia whipped the sweat from her brow as she fell onto the couch, her legs giving out from under her. She went into her room and shut the door as her mother began setting up for Arcadia's friends, Alex. With his parent's permission, Alex was allowed to stay at her house the entire weekend. Mom and Dad trust Arcadia enough to leave her and Alex alone for a few hours while they go and pick up their eldest daughter, Megan, from the airport; just getting back from visiting her grandparents in Germany. Arcadia agreed, along with Alex, and Her mother began setting the living room up with snacks of all sorts and drinks, movies included ^^.

The doorbell rang as Arcadia sat on the couch, reading her Halo: the fall of reach book and her mom ran out happily. "Answer it!" her mother urged almost in a hushed tone and Arcadia simply rolled her eyes as she walked to the front door. She swung open the door and looked the guy before her up and down, taking in all his features.

"Alex?" She asked hopefully. His face lit up as he smiled, his eyes sparkled in amusement. He nodded and opened his arms, bringing her into a warm embrace. Arcadia laughed and wrapped her arms around him as well, her Mother walking into the living room.

"Ok you two...I'm trusting you. don’t disappoint me" Her mother's voice was soft but serious as she hugged her daughter and waved to Alex before heading out the door for the weekend. Arcadia sighed exhaustingly and fell onto the couch behind her. Alex laughed and sat down on the other end of the couch as he began to poke her head repeatedly. He laughed as she twitched with each poke.

"What're you doing?" she laughed and smiled up at him

"Nothing..." he laughed and poked her stomach. Arcadia shot up and laughed loudly.

"Ok...I'm going to go grab some movies...you sit here and get comfy.." she said in a seductive tone and headed up the stairs.

He grinned and nodded as she left upstairs. Alex stretched out on the couch, trying to get comfortable. As he watched the room around him, something caught his eyes; a strange purple vial on the fireplace, glowing in the fires light and casting a rainbow on the wall behind it. He quickly jumped to his feet and wandered over to the fireplace, the warmth oddly attracting him. Alex gripped the bottle tightly and popped open the corked lid with ease. A strange berry smell filled the air and he breathed deeply, enjoying the heavenly scent. Alex tilted the bottle and dipped his pinky into the liquid, a purple ooze filling the tip of his finger. He quickly darted his tongue out and swallowed the small amount. It was delicious! He quickly tipped the bottle to his lips, taking a very long chug of it before setting back onto the fireplace.

"What the hell did I just do?" He sighed and sat back onto the couch, grabbing a handful of chips. Alex's stomach gurgled rather loudly and he grabbed it in pain, his body screaming in utter pain. He gasped as he rolled onto his back, clenching his eyes as his breathing became rugged. Alex opened his eyes to the see the world spinning around him at an amazing speed! He shut his eyes tight and whimpered in pain before he fell into utter darkness. A strange, yet very strong, smell of many different forms of food filling his nostrils. He moaned tiredly and stretched his legs before reaching out to touch the couches back to help him sit up, but it wasn't there...Alex's eyes snapped open immediately, but he couldn't see the ceiling, only darkness. He stood up lazily and grabbed his head. He was surrounded in some kind of grass, reaching his waist line, and making it hard to move. He gripped at it but his hand shot back. this wasn't grass...IT WAS CARPET!

"Holy shit" Cried Alex as he looked to his left to see unfathomable sized couch leg. "I SHRUNK?!" He cried and spun around much too fast, causing him to fall into the deep carpet. This could be a huge problem..

11.content:
Alex sighed as his eyes traveled upward; miles above him laid his new goal. He would have to climb up the table somehow and then get Arcadia's attention somehow!

"Might as well start now! What else do I got to do?" and with those slightly optimistic words, Alex began his journey, first reaching one of the table legs. He roamed around the giant table leg, his had brushing against it's seeming smooth surface for something he could get a grip on.

Suddenly his hand had hit a nitch in the wood, something that would give a normal sized person a splinter! Testing it's sturdiness before letting go of the ground, Alex hoisted himself upward, his no slip shoes actually coming in handy for once!

Moments later, Alex had reached a point where he could sit down and rest on the edge momentarily. His eyes scanned the room; the once normal sized room seemed slightly more intimidating at this size.

"So...it finally became a reality, huh?" Alex asked himself almost like this was some weird dream or reality show.

With his breath regained, Alex began hi journey upward once more. Moments later he had arrived at the tables edge and was struggling because there was no where to grip his feet firmly.

"Maybe gym class really did pay off!" Alex joked between gritted teeth as he pushed himself upward and onto the gleaming smooth surface. Mountains of pretzels and candy filled the sky as Alex looked about. There were lakes of chocolate and punch, and marshmallow and strawberry fields. Alex grinned up at the strawberries, licking his lips and wondering how wonderful those strawberries would taste at this height; their flavor must be AMAZING! Alex looked at the stairs and back at the strawberries: it had taken him about 4 or so muntes to get up here...and that’s when he stopped! He couldn’t control it as his stomach urged him onward: he rushed for the bowl!

Looking up, there was no way he was going to be able to climb just the bowl straight up to sweets. Alex looked around and snapped his fingers in brilliant thought: he could climb the grapes next to the bowl, and then use the vine to swing over to the strawberries! Seems kind of cartoonish , but hey! What else is there to do; sit and wait? No. Alex walked over to some of the grapes that were spilled over the side of the bowl, and gripping the lowest one, began to climb.




What's going to happen next?

Minutes passed by and finally he reached the rim of the bowl! It was a rather thick rim so he could easily walk a little ways and still be safe from the edge. Alex wiggled beneath the mammoth grape. Opening wide, Alex began to bite into the green fruit. With each bite, a small piece of the seemingly giant fruit disappeared. After what seemed like moments upon hours, Alex had reached the summit of his journey and fell down onto the soft springy cushion of the couch. His head was pounding along with his heart and he sighed; finally giving his tired legs and arms a rest. The couch had a thick scent of something sweet...maybe it was the extra perfume that had spread on the couch? Alex didn’t care at the moment though. as he stood and looked around; the view to him had changed COMPLETELY! The sun shown brightly from the window, cascading off the punch bowl on the table and casting it's glow where it may. Alex smiled and leaned against the now gigantic couch arm peacefully.

The sound of feet shuffling from above made Alex remember his mission: To get Arcadia's attention!

"Alex! Here I come!" Arcadia called playfully down the stairs as she made her way down to him. Alex looked around and began to climb up the arm rest, just as he had done with climbing the couch. Seconds later, he stood up on the arm rest, feeling proud of himself! Suddenly the ground shook followed by Arcadia calling out to him once more. Arcadia asked as she wandered about the bottom floor for her no-where to be found guest. Alex jumped up and down, trying to gain the giantess' awareness, but he couldn't before she walked into the kitchen.

"Well what am I gunna do now?!" Alex sighed in annoyance and boredom as the sight of a giantess...a REAL life giantess walking past him began to die off.

"Well...what am I going to do now...she doesn’t even look at me!" he sighed as he sat down on the cushiony ground and pondered. "I wonder if she'll ever notice me..?" Alex's thought was interrupted as the world around him grew dark and began to shake violently. His world turned upside down as Arcadia jumped over the couch to lay down on it! Alex spun through the air like a fairground thrill ride, his stomach far behind him!
